<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 165, 235]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 260]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[724, 220, 720, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[867, 220, 901, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[869, 220, 901, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[51, 201, 80, 230]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 201, 195, 217]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 219, 424, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[619, 220, 722, 245]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[878, 220, 901, 236]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[736, 216, 905, 259]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[47, 241, 80, 270]]<|/det|> <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 279, 231, 294]]<|/det|> # MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 304, 311, 319]]<|/det|> Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[759, 304, 908, 321]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 328, 907, 344]]<|/det|> 1 hour 50 minutes <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 395, 372]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 391, 402]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 225, 432]]<|/det|> # INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 467]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 867, 545]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 620]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 715]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 391, 107]]<|/det|>
1 A curve has equation \(y=2 x+\frac{12}{x^{2}}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 123, 918, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point（－2，－1）．Give your answer in the form \(y=m x+c\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 511, 91]]<|/det|>
2 The first two terms of a geometric progression are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 99, 572, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
4 \sin ^{2} \theta, \quad 8 \sin ^{3} \theta
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 134, 454, 154]]<|/det|>
where \(\theta\) is an angle such that \(0<\theta<\frac{1}{6} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 164, 918, 185]]<|/det|>
Given that the sum to infinity of the progression is \(\frac{1}{2}\), find the value of \(\theta\). Give your answer in the form \(\sin ^{-1} k\), where \(k\) is a rational number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 669, 118]]<|/det|>
3 Given that \(\int_{1}^{3}\left(\frac{a}{(4 x-3)^{2}}+2\right) \mathrm{d} x=12\), find the value of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 780, 105]]<|/det|>
4 (a) Find the first three terms in the expansion of \(\left(2-\frac{3}{2} x\right)^{5}\) in ascending powers of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 521, 857, 543]]<|/det|>
(b) Use your answer to part (a), with a suitable value of \(x\), to find an approximation to \(1.985^{5}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 921, 91]]<|/det|>
6 An arithmetic progression has first term \(a\) and common difference 2 . The \(N\)th term is 55 and the sum of the first \(3 N\) terms is 5760 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 333, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(N\) and \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 432, 107]]<|/det|>
7 A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=3 x^{2}+10 x-8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 648, 140]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the set of values of \(x\) for which \(y\) decreases as \(x\) increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 431, 686, 449]]<|/det|>
(b) It is given that the maximum point of the curve has \(y\)-coordinate 27 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 462, 399, 479]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 90]]<|/det|>
8

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[365, 87, 635, 261]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 279, 918, 298]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a square \(A B C D\) where each side has length 12 cm . Points \(E\) and \(F\) lie on the sides \(B C\) and \(C D\) respectively and are such that \(B E=\frac{1}{3} B C\) and \(D F=\frac{1}{3} D C\). The arc \(E F\) is part of a circle

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 314, 846, 333]]<|/det|>
with centre \(A\). The shaded region is bounded by the \(\operatorname{arc} E F\) and the line segments \(E C\) and \(F C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 343, 793, 364]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that the size of angle \(E A F\) is 0.9273 radians, correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 497, 471, 517]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 714, 432, 733]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
9 Three points \(P, Q\) and \(R\) have coordinates \(P(-13, 5), Q(5, 1)\) and \(R(2, k)\), where \(k\) is a constant. It is given that the angle \(P Q\) is a right angle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 123, 785, 140]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that one of the possible values of \(k\) is 10 , and find the other possible value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 731, 93]]<|/det|>
(b) It is now given that \(k=10\). A circle passes through the points \(P, Q\) and \(R\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the circle at \(R\). Give your answer in the form \(a x+b y+c=0\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 76, 463, 105]]<|/det|>
10 A curve \(C\) has equation \(y=\frac{9}{2 x-5}+2 x-5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 113, 540, 131]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the coordinates of the two stationary points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 611, 672, 646]]<|/det|>
(b) Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} y}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}}\) and hence determine the nature of each stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 918, 112]]<|/det|>
(c) The curve \(C\) is transformed to the curve \(C_{1}\) using a translation of \(\binom{-3}{7}\) followed by reflection in

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 109, 240, 126]]<|/det|>
the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 138, 590, 159]]<|/det|>
(i) State the coordinates of the maximum point of \(C_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 351, 918, 380]]<|/det|>
(ii) Find the equation of \(C_{1}\) in the form \(y=\frac{a}{b x+c}+d x+e\), where \(a, b, c, d\) and \(e\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 750, 96]]<|/det|>
11 The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x)=x^{2}+4 a x+a\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\), where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 556, 127]]<|/det|>
The function g is such that \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)=\sqrt[3]{2 x-4}\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 140, 693, 159]]<|/det|>
(a) Given that the range of f is \(\mathrm{f}(x) \geqslant-33\), find the possible values of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 556, 93]]<|/det|>
(b) Given instead that \(\mathrm{ffg}(0)=96\), find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
